source.e1439088:
# import the library
import pandas as pd
import tensorflow as tf
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error
source.86c27148:
# make the variable
independent_variable = data['1stFlrSF']+data['2ndFlrSF']
dependent_variable = data['SalePrice']
source.eceebc32:
# make the model
X = tf.keras.layers.Input(shape=[1])
Y = tf.keras.layers.Dense(1)(X)
model_1 = tf.keras.models.Model(X,Y)
model_1.compile(loss='mae')
source.a6968c78:
#predict the output and calculate MAE
predict_1 = model_1.predict(independent_variable)
mean_absolute_error(predict_1,dependent_variable)
source.83f4034d:
X = tf.keras.layers.Input(shape=[4])
Y = tf.keras.layers.Dense(1)(X)
model_2 = tf.keras.models.Model(X,Y)
model_2.compile(loss='mae')
source.af5da382:
X = tf.keras.layers.Input(shape=[4])
H = tf.keras.layers.Dense(3,activation='swish')(X)
Y = tf.keras.layers.Dense(1)(H)
model_3 = tf.keras.models.Model(X,Y)
model_3.compile(loss='mae')
source.7c51d2b6:
# welcome to the deep learning world !

In this notebook, we will make the simpleist deep learning model. so if you are afraid of starting the deep learning, I'll bet you can overcome it according to this. You can make the first step to the deep learning. So what we gonna do is this.

* make the neural network model
* using tensorflow library
* and apply to regression problem

The altimating goal of this is to predict the housing price, and we'll only focus on numerical variable. And the we will measure the accuracy by mean absolute error.


Then Let's do this !!

source.0ce52e7e:
# second step with multiple input

To improve the accuracy, we can use more variable to input. So in this time, we set the independent variable that every variable that associated with 'Area'. There are several variable match with this feature.

* 'LotArea' : Lot size in square feet
* 'GrLivArea' : Above grade (ground) living area square feet
* 'GarageArea': Size of garage in square feet
* 'PoolArea' : Pool area in square feet

![2](https://ifh.cc/g/0oMwWN.png)
source.c509952d: We can get the lowest MAE according to this model !!
source.586052ba:
# First step with one input

As you can see, there are so many columns in the dataset. It is very confusing to us!! So at first, we assume that only one input will affect to housing price. Let's pick the one. what variable is appropriate? Just the intuitive thought, I think the square feet of the house will affect to the price. So I'll add the '1stFlrSF', '2ndFlrSF' and set this as independent variable.

* '1stFlrSF' : First Floor square feet
* '2ndFlrSF' : Second floor square feet

Then how can we make the model?

![1](https://ifh.cc/g/WopRIg.png)
source.d614dadf: The mean absolute error of this model is pretty high. We want to make more accurate estimate. what should we do?
